abstract: Oracle said Monday that Larry Ellison, its chief executive, set up a prearranged plan to sell up to 50 million shares — or about 4 percent of his stake in the company – over 10 months, The Associated Press reported.
snippet: Oracle said Monday that Larry Ellison, its chief executive, set up a prearranged plan to sell up to 50 million shares — or about 4 percent of his stake in the company – over 10 months, The Associated Press reported.
lead_paragraph: Oracle said Monday that Larry Ellison, its chief executive, set up a prearranged plan to sell up to 50 million shares — or about 4 percent of his stake in the company — over 10 months, The Associated Press reported.

headline.main: Oracle C.E.O. Sets Up Prearranged Trading Plan
